data.title: Heat"™s Chris Bosh to miss All-Star Game
data.text:
TORONTO "” For a second consecutive year, Miami Heat forward Chris Bosh will have his season interrupted around the NBA All-Star Break.

The only difference is this time it happened before, and not, after the game.

On Friday, Bosh was ruled out of the weekend festivities because of a strained calf. He will miss both the 3-point contest Saturday and Sunday"™s game at Air Canada Center. The league announced Atlanta Hawks forward Al Horford as his replacement in the game, and Portland"™s C.J. McCollum was added to the 3-point competition.

Bosh even looked toward the second half of the season.

"œWell, I mean, we have to be more consistent," Bosh said. "œWe"™re still, of course, like a mix of young and old and we try to figure things out as a team. But we need to be more consistent and put a string of wins together and not let a bad loss knock us off course of what we"™re trying to do."

The injury appeared to have caught both players off guard. Wade spoke at length at what it was going to be like watching Bosh in the 3-point contest for the first time.

"œIt"™s going to be fun," Wade said. "œI"™m looking forward to it."

Afterward, the two posed for pictures and held a joint photo session for the league. Wade posted some of the images to his Snapchat account.

The narrative changed a few hours later.

Yahoo Sports first reported Bosh would miss the game because of injury. It marked the second consecutive year a Heat player was sidelined. Last season Wade opted not to play because of hamstring issues.

For Bosh, it slows the momentum he gained the past five months. He survived a scary ordeal when his life was threatened because of the blood clots. He wasn"™t allowed to do anything basketball-related for seven months.

A healthy Bosh returned to the court last September, quickly reverting to old form. His averages of 19.1 points and 7.4 rebounds while shooting a team-high 36.5 percent from the 3-point line were enough to earn an 11th All-Star appearance.

The injury also ruined Bosh"™s opportunity to play an All-Star game in the city of the team that drafted him. Bosh played for the Raptors from 2003-10 before joining the Heat.
